141111121211111112.content:
You finally came to. You had a bad headache, and all you could remember was some extremely stressful event caused you to faint. You saw something on the monitor, and it overwhelmed you. You curled your knees up to your chin while sitting on the floor, wondering what happened. You looked at the laptop. When you fell, you dropped the laptop, and unfortunately the way it landed had caused it to break. The cable that was connected to the house system was torn from the laptop itself, even. Sighing, you stood up and stretched before straightening out your blouse and adjusting your pants so they sat right on your hips.

You tried to remember again. What was going on? Who were you, even? Where were you? You had amnesia! You knew you were a woman. That much was a given, just by looking down. It also felt normal ... sort of. With no other contextual clues, you decided to press the power button on this house's system. The lights flickered a bit as the machine came to life. The whirring of the machine's systems was familiar and comforting for some reason.

You watched the boot sequence on the screen, before "Welcome to CARA OS" finally popped up. Then the machine spoke, "Hello, I am CARA, your personal assistant and smart house. Please state your name and gender." You were lost. You said, "Uhh... Are there any backups? I think your system was reset."

CARA said, "Searching for backups . . . No backups found. Please state your name and gender." CARA had been completely reformatted! You were confused. "Uhh, I don't remember my own name either. But I am a woman, I guess..." You gestured to your boobs and hips, accentuated by your tight blouse and jeans. It didn't feel entirely right, but it had to be right. The evidence was right there!

"Gender: female. Name: unknown. An internet search has determined that you are likely suffering from amnesia. I will present a list of names and hopefully jog your memory." You nodded, and the screen presented names one after another. Finally, you settled on "Taylor." It felt almost right, although you weren't really sure if you were a "Taylor." It would do for now.

"Name: Taylor. Gender: female. Thank you Taylor, I can now begin to assist you. Are you the legal owner of this house?" You shrugged and said, "I... think so? I mean, I seem to be living here." You looked at a picture on the wall, and saw a picture of yourself (actually Sara--not really you!) with three other women, all hugging and having a good time.

"Thank you Taylor. As the legal owner of this property, you have full administrative access. Now, how may I assist you?" You thought about it for a little bit...
141111121211111112.title: With no memories of being either Tom or Sara

1411111212111111121.content:
"Well..." you mused. "I should probably take a trip outside to see if anything could stir my memories. At the very least I should know where I am."

"Understood, Taylor. Come upstairs to the bedroom so that I can prepare you for your task." CARA said.

You walked to the stairs and walked into the bedroom, passing pictures on a dresser that depicted you and some man, but one that looked very similar to you.

"Guess I have a brother." you said. "Maybe I should track him down..."

"Before we start Taylor, I do not have any preset style parameters set up for you." CARA said. "I will ask you a series of questions in order to figure out what you most desire."

"Okay." you said. "Go ahead."

"Do you have a favorite color?" CARA asked.

You looked around the room, the bedspread was pink, and while you were wearing a purple shirt currently... You didn't feel as if purple was your favorite color.

"Pink." you said. "Until I remember what mine is."

"Noted. Do you prefer masculine or feminine clothing?" CARA asked.

"Hmm... That's a good question." you started.

You were wearing jeans currently, but you knew you were doing some sort of work... and you could vaguely remember liking the feeling of your skirt fluttering and liking your legs in heels.

"Feminine." you said.

"Noted." CARA said. "Style profile created. Would you like to get dressed now, or would you like to be more specific in your profile?"

"Hmm..." you started.
1411111212111111121.title: Ask CARA to help you prepare for a walk around ...

14111112121111111211.content:
"Let's just do it now, I can always answer more questions when my memories start to come back." you said.

"Understood, Taylor." CARA said.

CARA shot arms out of the wall, which grabbed you and carried you into the bathroom. You were put through a wringer of washing, drying, a little bit of shaving, culminating with a towel being wrapped turban-style on your head and around your chest. It was the first time you had seen your body nude... at least the first time you can remember. Something still feels off, but you can't place it.

Following the shower, CARA placed you down into a chair in front of the vanity, where the towel was removed and your hair was blow-dried and styled. With you approving the style, CARA moved onto the rest, which involved CARA stripping your fingernails and toenails of the french tipped style and replacing it with a bright pink color. Your makeup was also re-done to accommodate your new color pallet.

Next, CARA stood you up and placed you into a pink push up bra and matching panties, before sliding a pink sundress over your head and lowering you into a pair of pink heeled sandals.

Are you satisfied, Taylor?" CARA asked.

"I think I am." you said.

"Design parameters saved. This will help me reconstruct your user profile in the future." CARA said.

The arms draped a pink patent leather purse over your shoulder and carried you to the door.

"Enjoy your walk, Taylor." CARA said.

"Thank you." you said, as you left the house.

You walked down a few blocks, taking in the sights, waiting for something to stir a memory, to no avail. You make it to a local park and you walk around, looking for something, ANYTHING, to jog a memory. You're so trapped in your thoughts that you didn't realize you were about to walk straight into the path of a jogger!

The jogger slammed into you, knocking you both onto the ground. The jogger recovered faster and immediately leapt to help you, holding out his hand and helping you up. You stand up and the jogger introduces himself.

"Hi, my name is..." the jogger starts.
14111112121111111211.title: Get dressed now

141111121211111112111.content:
"Hi, my name is Jason." the jogger says. "I guess I should watch where I'm going."

You felt a tickling in your mind. That you knew the jogger, but you couldn't access any of the memories.

"I'm Taylor." you said.

The jogger looked at your face intently and scrutinized it, seeing a cute girl... though there was something about her face.

"You okay?" you asked.

"Yeah, it's just that you look really familiar, but I can't put my finger on where I've seen you before." Jason said.

"Oh my god! I have the same feeling!" you exclaimed.

You both laughed.

"I can't figure it out." Jason said. "I would remember if I knew you, though."

"...This is going to sound weird but... I have a problem." you started. "I have some memory loss and I came out here trying to jog my memories back. And it jogged recognition of you but nothing else."

"Oh my god, do you need to see a doctor?" Jason asked.

"No.. I don't think so. Not yet at least. But I was wondering if you'd walk me home, and maybe take a look around and see if you know who I am." you replied.

"You're right. That does sound weird." Jason said.

"What do you say?" you asked.
141111121211111112111.title: Jason (One of Tom's friends)

1411111212111111121111.content:
"I might regret this... but I'll do it." Jason said.

"Thank you so much! I owe you!" you excitedly smiled and led Jason back towards your house.

When you arrived at the door, it immediately swung open. You walked inside, with Jason following behind you. As you did, CARA's arms closed the door behind you.

"Welcome home, Taylor. Who are you with?" CARA asked.

"This is Jason. I think he knows me." you replied.

"Jason added to authorized persons list." CARA stated.

"What was that?" he asked.

"The house has a computer that runs it. I think I built it." you replied.

"Neat!" Jason exclaimed.

The two of you started looking around the living room, with Jason stopping near a photo of two children, a boy and a girl. and their parents.

"Is this you?" Jason asked, pointing to the girl in the photo.

"I guess it would have to be, right?" you replied.

"And you don't know who the boy is?"

"No..." you sighed. "This is pointless, you can go. Sorry for causing all this trouble."

"No, wait. I want to help, I feel like I might know your brother or something, and I want to help you." Jason said.

You felt some sort of attraction to Jason, not necessarily romantic, but you felt like you can trust him. Like you've trusted him before. You started to tear up and quickly embraced Jason in a hug.

"Thank you." you said.

"No problem." Jason said. "Now, let's..."
1411111212111111121111.title: Jason agrees

choices: A platonic, though strictly friendly, relationship.
14111112121111111211111.content:
"... Look around for clues. There must be something in this house." You kicked off your slightly impractical shoes and agreed to search the house top to bottom with Jason. It took you the better part of an hour, but eventually you had collected photo albums and old boxes from the attic. It did not take long for the two of you to figure out that your name was Sara, and that you had a brother named Tom. Jason had known Tom. He said the two of you looked very similar. The evidence was all there in the photos, year books, and old school assignments. The two of you laughed at some of the pictures, vaguely recalling comical events from the past.

However, this did not give you the grand epiphany you were expecting. You were recalling bits and pieces of your past as if you were a third-party observer, not the one that experienced the events directly. As you closed the last box, you sighed. Hours of going through it all, and you still felt like a stranger in your own body. Your name was supposedly Sara, but you didn't feel like a Sara. You didn't feel like a Tom either. You just felt like a ... Taylor, a woman who felt slightly confused and slightly "off."

You were at least becoming more comfortable with the whole situation, after the initial shock had died down. The knowledge that you were Sara gave you a concrete base to work from. You at least didn't feel COMPLETELY alien in your own skin anymore. You'd definitely have to diversify from the color pink a bit though.

"Sara?" Jason asked. You snapped back to reality. "I, uh, can you maybe not call me that? At least not yet? I don't feel like a 'Sara.' It's hard to explain... Just Taylor for now." Your new friend nodded understandingly. "Alright, well, Taylor? You've been through a lot today. Maybe it's time to take a break. I'll get us something to drink." You nodded silently, and Jason said, "CARA, can you make us a nice summery drink? Perhaps some lemonade?"

"Of course Jason," said the robotic house assistant. A few minutes later, the robotic arms of the house had placed two glasses of lemonade on the coffee table in front of you. Each of you took a glass in hand. Jason made a lame toast, which made you giggle a bit. He said, "To Toms and Saras."

"To Toms and Saras," you replied, and clinked the glasses together.

You turned on the TV and settled for watching a movie with Jason to pass the time. It was something both of you had seen before, but it was still entertaining. You were a bit fidgety during the movie, and kept shifting to get comfortable. You wound up using Jason as a pillow. You felt a sense of safety, curled up against him. You didn't really ask if you could, but Jason definitely silently welcomed and encouraged your contact. By the end of the movie, he had his arm wrapped around you. "So I don't lose circulation," he said.

Your heart was racing a bit. You had genuinely connected with another person. It had all happened so fast. What were you feeling?
14111112121111111211111.title: Look around for clues

141111121211111112111111.content:
You think it's romantic attraction. You feel safe around Jason, and feeling his arm around you made you feel even safer. You looked up at Jason as the credits rolled.

"Jason." you said. "Thank you."

"No problem. It's the least I can do for my friend's sister." he said.

You smiled as you laid back against Jason, before CARA piped in.

"The movie has ended, Taylor. Would you like to watch something else?" CARA asked.

You looked up at Jason and thought for a moment.

"You know what? I think we're good like this. I just want to relax for right now." you said.

"All right, Taylor. Let me know if you or your friend need me." CARA said.

For a while, you and Jason stayed exactly as you were. Safe and secure. It was nice until you were taken out of that serenity by...
141111121211111112111111.title: Romantic attraction.

Tom has a moment of lucidity during the date!
1411111212111111121111112.content:
Your phone rang, interrupting the special silence you and Jason were sharing. You looked at the caller ID. It was a girl named Maria. You recognized this as one of Sara's... your friends, but no memories of her really surfaced. You put the phone on silent, desiring to return to that safe and secure embrace. "Who was it?" he asked. "One of my friends, I think. It's not important right now. I can call her back later." Jason nodded, and stood up.

"Listen, I've got to go now, but I liked today."

"Me too," you said.

"I hope this doesn't seem too forward, but would you maybe like to get a drink some time soon?" You answered "Yes!" enthusiastically almost before Jason finished his question. "Awesome! Uh, how about tomorrow?" You nodded enthusiastically and hugged Jason one final time. "Thanks for your help today, Jason. Hopefully I'll remember more by tomorrow and maybe I can tell you more about myself." You laughed awkwardly, idly brushing a lock of hair behind your ear. Oh God, what was happening? Were you FLIRTING? You weren't even great at it. Jason smiled. "That would be nice. See you tomorrow."

After you closed the door behind you, you leaned against it and stared up at the ceiling. Was your life becoming a romantic comedy? Lose your memory and fall in love with the first man you see? You took a deep breath and took stock of the situation. The stuff from the attic still needed to be cleaned up, and you needed to do something about this date you had just spontaneously agreed to. "CARA, can you clean up the mess here?"

"Of course, Taylor."

"Also, can you help me pick out something to wear tomorrow?" you asked. "Of course, Taylor." CARA simultaneously assisted you with style choices while moving the boxes downstairs back into the attic. You went through a handful of different outfits before finally settling on a cream-colored v-neck blouse and a coral pink A-line skirt, along with nude pumps. It still had what you guessed was your favorite color, but was a bit less garish than your previous outfit.

Later, you called back Maria. She was just curious as to what you were up to. You didn't tell her much, including the fact that you had lost your memory. You did tell her about your date though, and she was enthusiastic for you! You went to bed that night very confused, not sure exactly what you were feeling about Jason or the date that lay ahead of you the next day.

The next day, your heart was aflutter. You dressed for the date early. Before you dressed, you looked at yourself nude. Something still felt off, but you couldn't place your finger on it. You felt more normal today, at least. Some memories had returned the night before. You were definitely a Sara, but you still didn't really feel like it. So, Taylor you remained.

CARA slipped you into the outfit; the skirt tickled your smooth legs with each step. You had to admit it, you looked hot. Jason was going to love it. Wait, did you really just think that?
1411111212111111121111112.title: A phone ringing

14111112121111111211111121.content:
The conversation was flowing smoothly! The two of you were intensely focused on one another! No one else in the bar mattered. Jason was your world, and you were his. You talked for what seemed like hours. You laughed at all his corny jokes, and he was endeared by your frankly sad attempts at flirting back. Before today, you had felt confused, not really sure who you were at all. But with Jason, none of that mattered. He made you feel safe, secure, and loved. You wanted to be the best you could be for him. You wanted to be feminine for him. You wanted to be pretty for him. He equaled you intellectually too. You had never had a deeper discussion about the history of science before. You didn't even know you knew that much about the history of science!

Somewhere extremely deep within you, there was a voice saying that this felt wrong. But it didn't matter. Your feminine side had completely taken over; you were enraptured by this man. You had excitedly told him that some of your memories came back. You were an inventor by trade, and you remembered where you worked (which was good, since you'd have to go in tomorrow). Your date was enthusiastic, and encouraging.

After drinks, the two of you wandered around the city's downtown, you clutching your purse like a giddy schoolgirl while Jason confidently led the way in your meandering. You weren't going anywhere in particular, you just enjoyed being with him. Eventually, you silently interlocked hands. "Taylor, I really like you. You're a cool girl." Jason smiled with a silly grin. You blushed and replied, "I-I think I really like you too. You're so nice, and you make me feel safe. Also, you smell great!" He laughed. "We should definitely do this again," you enthused. Jason readily agreed. You walked on for a bit longer through a park. Your feet were starting to hurt from wearing the high heels so long, but you didn't really care.

The date came to an end on the other side of the park. The two of you made plans for another date within a few days, and parted ways. You hailed a cab and went home. Once you were back, you jumped on the couch and started furiously texting Maria about your adventure. She was the only friend you felt safe talking to with your current memory problems.

"He is SOOO hot, and so cute :)!"


"I know, girl. You snagged a good one."


"When are you going out next?"


"In three days!!" you practically smashed the virtual keyboard.


"Wow, so cool! Are you official yet?"


"No, not yet... but who knows next time!"
14111112121111111211111121.title: The date goes excellently, pushing Taylor towar...

141111121211111112111111211.content:
You sat on the couch with Jason, watching another movie, though you two were more preoccupied with kissing than with the movie. CARA had noticed that and stopped pausing the movie every time you started, because "You obviously are more interested in this than the film". Maria had been excited to hear that after your last date, you were finally official. After you had pulled away to breathe a little, Jason's phone buzzed.

"Whoops." he said, looking at it. "Sorry, it's work. Gotta reply to this..."

"Hurry up, babe." you cooed.

"Inventor, mostly. I work through grants from the local university. Actually, they want me to go in in-person tomorrow for a presentation." you said. "CARA! You have the experiment I was working on ready to go, right?"

"Of course, Taylor" CARA said.

"I just hope they don't ask about how I started it, cause I still can't remember." you mused. "Eh, probably nothing to worry about. So, where were we?"

You and Jason started up again, and if CARA had eyes to roll, she would have. Another phone started to ring, the house phone, but CARA had taken care to silence it during the movie. Little did you know, that throughout the past week, Sara, the real one, had been calling the house to tell Tom that she had gotten an offer at the local university's satellite campus to work on an important project, and so would need Tom to watch her house indefinitely, but CARA was sure that these were wrong numbers, and had deleted the messages as they arrived.
141111121211111112111111211.title: One week later, Taylor has a boyfriend.

1411111212111111121111112111.content:
"Sara? Sara!" You blinked and snapped back to reality. That name still meant so little to you, but it was your legal name, or so it seemed. You breathed deeply, your breasts pushing against the tight soft pink tank top you wore. It was tucked into a beige pencil skirt, and completed by a beige blazer and white three inch open-toed pumps. It was summer; you felt that you should dress the part. Your hair was styled loose, sitting down past your shoulders. Your make-up was subtle and natural, hiding the few imperfections you had. You looked great, so you felt great! Over the past two weeks, you went from amnesia and feeling uncomfortable to a feeling of embracing womanhood, like you were coming out of a chrysalis transformed. Although your memory was stlil a bit hazy in certain areas, enough of it had come back so that you were fairly grounded in your identity.

You chose to once again ignore the ever-looming feeling that you still didn't feel like "you" yet. Wait, that wasn't right. You did feel like "you." Except "you" was Taylor, an inventor who was dating a great guy named Jason. "You" was not a woman named Sara.

You refocused. It was time to start your presentation. You confidently walked up to the stage, one foot in front of the other, your hips swaying back and forth. Such a young and beautiful woman in the scientific field had already captivated the audience, but now you would blow them away. You plugged the USB drive with the presentation into the stage laptop.

"I call it a Neuroinformational Transmitter!" you proudly announced. "My device allows anyone to learn a new skill in a matter of minutes. The applications are endless." You placed the headset on the table on the stage. "It's based on virtual reality technology. By wearing the headset and being exposed to the training modules installed, a user can learn practically any physical skill in a matter of minutes." You asked for volunteers from the audience, choosing an older man in the front row. When he came up to the stage, you continued.

"For example, have you ever wanted to be a ballerina, sir? Of course you have! I assure you, it's perfectly safe." With the man's consent, you placed the headset on him. "Now, I will activate the program in the headset that will teach this man to become the best ballerina this town has ever known!" You laughed, and the audience laughed along with you. The man chuckled nervously. You pressed the button, and the VR headset began its work.

While the man stood there silently absorbing the program, you went over technical details of the device for a few minutes. Finally, the device beeped, indicating it was ready to be removed. You took it off the man's head and asked him, "How do you feel, sir?"

"Alright, I guess. I've got a little headache."

"That should wear off in about a minute! Now, how about you show us your dancing skills!" He obliged, and bounded across the stage, dancing like a ballerina who had trained for decades at her craft. It was a female dance, which was a bit embarrassing for the man, but both he and the audience were wowed at his newfound abilities.

"Now," you said, "This -IS- a prototype. The effects of it should start wearing off after maybe ten minutes!" And true to your word, the man's demonstration of ballet slowly became worse and worse until it was a mockery of the art. "How about a round of applause for our volunteer here?!" you shouted, leading the crowd in a cheer for the man that had demonstrated your device so well.

The rest of the presentation went off without a hitch. You were confident and beaming, and answered every question smoothly. You got the feeling that you had never felt this confident before. Just another thing to love about the new you!
1411111212111111121111112111.title: The next day

14111112121111111211111121111.content:
After your presentation was over, you bumped into Jason in the hallway. He said, "Wow, that presentation was fantastic, babe!" You smiled and tried to shrug nonchalantly, but you once again came off as a giddy girl. "Oh, it was nothing," you blushed. You didn't even know Jason was in the audience. "So can it teach basically anything?" he asked with a wink. "Yep, pretty much." Your face got extremely red when you figured out what he was suggesting. He just laughed.

You clung to Jason's arm, and the two of you went off to eat lunch. You were happy, and nothing could bring you down. He took you to some pretentious hipster organic sandwich shop on the university campus. You had something small, while he got the double-decker club. Jason worked out, and ate a lot of calories every day. You were intently focused on the flexing of his muscles as he devoured the sandwich, perhaps too much so. Although your legs were sort of trapped by your skirt, you could feel something happening down there. You crossed them tightly to avoid any embarrassment. It felt weird, like something inside you was trapped and trying to get out. But you pushed the thought aside.

"Taylor?" Jason's voice brought you back down to Earth. "Earth to Taylor?" You stared at Jason for a split second, preferring to break the awkwardness by shoving your sandwich into your mouth rather than speaking. "I was really impressed by your presentation, Tay. It's a great idea and has great applications. Like you said, pretty much anything." You smiled. "Yep. Pretty much anything..." you mused. "I wasn't entirely kidding about having fun with it later," Jason said slyly. You blushed again.

After you finished lunch, it was time for both you and Jason to get back to work. Your job was uneventful for the remainder of the day, aside from a few people congratulating you on the presentation or even wanting to try out the device itself. You did notice that people were paying more attention in general to you today. For the past week, you hadn't really been caring about your appearance, too lost in thought trying to remember who you were. But on the day you finally put the effort in, you were suddenly noticed by your entire department, it seemed like. You made a mental note to upgrade CARA's definition of your work wardrobe.

Back at home, CARA had placed the mail on the table. On top, you found an envelope addressed to "Tom." You reverently grabbed the envelope with your perfectly manicured fingers and looked it over. It had a return address from one of the university's satellite campuses A letter for your brother? You hadn't seen him or contacted him since the accident. Then again, you didn't even really remember him. The best you had were fuzzy images.

Unbeknownst to you, the letter was from the real Sara. After she had failed to call or email you, she resorted to old-fashioned snail mail to explain her situation.

Do you open the letter?
14111112121111111211111121111.title: You bump into Jason after the presentation.

141111121211111112111111211111.content:
You carefully sliced the envelope open with your fingernail and pulled out the letter. You read it, confused. The letter claimed to be from YOU, addressed to your brother. He would have to watch the house indefinitely, as she had accepted a job on one of the university's satellite campuses. "CARA? Did I send a letter to my brother? Should I be on the satellite campus of the university right now?" The AI responded, "I am sorry, Taylor. I do not know, as all memory banks were erased in the crash." You sighed. Great. Even CARA couldn't help. Or could she?

"CARA, could you run a search for my social media presence online? With my legal name?" The AI responded affirmatively. "Please wait. Processing. I have found your social media profile, Taylor." A notification popped up on your phone. CARA had sent the details of the profile to it. You opened it up and checked the recent public activity. There was nothing from before your accident. The last thing mentioned was that you were going on vacation for a week, and that was about two and a half weeks ago. You didn't remember this. You scrolled through the publicly visible pictures. The woman in them looked like you, and you had a few hazy memories of taking them. Your social media--which you did not have the login for--seemed to mostly be in order.

That left the question of who wrote the letter. The only logical solution was that it had to be you, and that you had gotten a job on the satellite campus. You mmust've been at your new job before the accident. Perhaps you had come home to get some things, and then the accident happened? But where was Tom? And why weren't people at the university asking why you were still on the main campus? Although your self-concocted story made logical sense, it had more than a few holes in it. "CARA, what is my office location listed as on the university website?" you wondered. "It is listed to be on the main campus, Taylor." While this was true, the university simply hadn't updated Sara's profile yet, as she had only just taken the job offer.

You kicked your heels off and sat down on the couch. Everything made enough sense that you figured you shouldn't question it, but nothing made enough sense that you shouldn't question it. You sighed heavily, feeling the tight fabric of your top stretch against your skin. The only real solution would be to drive over to the satellite campus and figure out what was going on yourself. However, it was a long drive, and you had a long day. But it still gnawed at you. There was enough light left in the day, and some people might be working late. You might be able to get some information at the satellite campus.

Do you go today?
141111121211111112111111211111.title: Yes.

1411111212111111121111112111111.content:
Groaning, you dragged yourself off the couch, put your white pumps back on, grabbed your purse, and minced out to the car. "Time to drive to the satellite campus," you muttered to yourself. It was an hour away, but the drive was uneventful. You arrived on the tail end of rush hour, determined to get to the bottom of this weird mystery. You pulled into the parking lot of the satellite campus and marched straight into your department's building there. "Ah, Miss Andersen. Did you forget something?" The receptionist took you by surprise. "I, uh.. yes. Sorry, do you mind if I go up to the office?" She wave you forward. "No, not at all. Also, did you change your outfit?" You just shrugged awkwardly and walked past her. Andersen? You had never considered the fact that you had a last name. But there it was. Sara Andersen? Weird.

Upstairs, you walked briskly down the halls, your stiletto heels echoing loudly against the cold tile surface. You were looking for your new office, or someone who could tell you where it was. Eventually, you found an office marked with your name. It looked like a nice place: a large desk and even a windowed view over the quad. You entered the empty room and ran your hand across the desk, and even sat in the chair. It didn't feel quite adjusted for you, but it was definitely comfortable.

So far you were finding more questions than answers here. The situation mostly conformed to the narrative you made in your head, but if the receptionist's reaction was anything to go by, you had been here recently, possibly even earlier today. But that obviously wasn't happening, as you were at the main campus and with Jason all day. You don't remember losing any time. But then again, you were still having some memory issues. Were they getting worse? Were you blacking out and conducting science experiments on a different campus in a fugue?

Or what if there was another person living your life? What if you were living someone else's life? What if... What if you were Tom? It was a crazy thought, but he was the one missing variable in the whole equation, and you did look very similar. Irrationally, you stuck your hand down your skirt for a moment and felt around. There was definitely no way you could be Tom. You were a woman. You were comfortable in your own skin. You were smart, you were attractive. You had a boyfriend! You liked who you were, or at least who you had turned into after the accident.

A well of anxiety that Jason had helped you push aside came rushing up once again! You were starting to get confused. There were a lot of unanswered questions here.
1411111212111111121111112111111.title: Yes.

choices: Double date with Jason, Maria, and her partner.
Work with CARA to change the decor in your house.
14111112121111111211111121111111.content:
You breathed a few times, calming down. You knew what you had to do. You were going to fix the problem. You didn't know who this woman was, and you didn't care. You were comfortable with yourself, your friends, and your life. Whoever you were before, it didn't matter anymore. With each calming breath, you could feel that anxiety and confusion drop, and eventually it vanished again. You picked up a piece of paper and a pen from the desk. You wrote to Sara as "Tom"--admittedly in very girly handwriting--that you were sorry you didn't return the calls or emails, and that you would happily look after the house for as long as Sara needed. Due to some technical glitches, you said it would be better for her to contact you by snail mail if it was necessary.

And then, you left. You drove home in complete silence; even the radio was turned off. You were deep in thought. It would soon be time to make some drastic changes to your life. But it would be your life, not someone else's. When you arrived home, you had CARA immediately change you into your pajamas, and you fell fast asleep. You hadn't realized it, but your long day had actually exhausted you. You were coasting on the fumes of adrenaline until your face hit the pillow, at which point you promptly fell asleep.

The next day, you put your plan into action. The first thing you did was send an email blast to your coworkers about moving to your new location at the satellite campus. You had to divorce yourself from your old professional life to move forward. "CARA, do you think you could get me a business loan? I've had some ideas and revelations, and I think it's time to completely switch things up."

"Of course, Taylor. Please upload your business plan and I will seek out favorable arrangements." You had been typing it since 5:00 AM. You barely slept. You were determined to take control of your life, and this was the first step. You were going to start your own business, earn your own income, and surround yourself with new people. Except Maria and Jason. They were too important to let go. You uploaded the document and let CARA get to work.

As if to reinforce your desire to be a woman, you had CARA dress you in something super girly, and she did not disappoint. You were wearing a figure-accenting floral sundress of whites, pinks, and pastel oranges. The bodice of the dress was tight against your body, while the skirt playfully flared out a little before reaching halfway down your thighs. You feet were supported in four inch cork wedge sandals. The outfit was completed with your hair in a pony tail, and your nails painted a light pink.

Your outfit reminded you that you were going to upgrade your work appearance. "CARA, please change my work style to be more classy. The more put-together I look, the more successful I'll be." The AI obliged, of course, and you continued about your day. You continued planning your assertion of your own identity.
14111112121111111211111121111111.title: Face the future as Taylor.

141111121211111112111111211111111.content:
Maria had been asking to meet Jason for a while, and if you were about to immerse yourself in Taylor's new life, you might not have time for a while, so you decided today was the best time to do it.

"CARA, call up Maria, please?" you asked.

"Of course, Taylor. Calling Maria." CARA responded.

After a few rings, Maria picked up.

"Taylor! What's up?" she asked.

"Are you busy today, I was thinking maybe we'd meet for lunch... and that I might bring a certain someone along with me?"

"OMG. You mean I'll finally get to meet this wonderful Jason? I'm in... Do you mind if I make it a double?"

"Not at all. I'll have CARA pick a restaurant and send you the details." you replied. "See you, then."

You hung up the phone.

"CARA..." you started.

"Already picking the restaurant and sending the address to Maria, Taylor."

"Very good."

You also called up Jason and asked if he wanted to do lunch, which he naturally did, and accepted. Not soon after, he picked you up and you both made your way to meet Maria and her partner.
141111121211111112111111211111111.title: Double date with Jason, Maria, and her partner.

choices: Another week later, Taylor has an entirely new life.
Over the week, a complication from Tom's past shows up.
1411111212111111121111112111111111.content:
The two of you arrived at a local restaurant named Wellspring Bar and Grill, so named because it was allegedly built on an undiscovered wellspring some decades ago. The restaurant was one of the more popular in town, but usually only for dinner. The four of you were easily able to reserve a table. Jason helped you out of the car. You eagerly took his hand and wrapped yourself around his arm as you walked into the restaurant. You were hyper-aware of everything. You latched to Jason's arm, the thin fabric of your dress, how it danced against your smooth legs with every step, the arch in your feet from the wedges. It all felt normal and right.

You found Maria and another woman sitting at one of the booths near the window. They stood up and everyone hugged. "This is Chelsea," Maria said. You didn't know Maria was into women, but it didn't bother you. "And this is Jason!" You said happily. Everyone introduced themselves and gave a few basic facts. Then, you settled in to eat. The lunch itself was rather uneventful for the most part. But what it did do was confirm to you that you had a close-knit group of friends in this new life.

"I'm starting a business and changing my name!" you announced. Both Jason and Maria just sort of stared at you, while Chelsea was just confused. "Ever since that accident with the amnesia, I just can't remember who I am, not really. Only bits and pieces have surfaced. I decided to just go all-in with my life as it is now. I've quit my job and got a business loan, and I'll officially be changing my name to Taylor next week." Maria said, "That's a bit drastic, isn't it? But for the record, I support it, if it makes you happy. And selfishly, I kind of like you better this way than the way you used to be as Sara. You're so much easier to talk to. It's not superficial anymore."

Jason also vocalized his support. "I support whatever you do, Tay. If it's what's necessary for my girlfriend to get better, then she'd better do it." You blushed, surprised that you had so much support. Tay... Jason had never called you that before. It felt a bit more natural and feminine than a full "Taylor." "Tay," you said. "I like it. Call me Tay."
1411111212111111121111112111111111.title: During the date

choices: The next day, you interview another one of Tom's old friends.
The next day, you interview one of Sara's former colleagues.
14111112121111111211111121111111111.content:
It had been another week, and you were doubling down and diving completely into your new life as Taylor "Tay" Andersen. You had been recovering for upwards of a month now, and so much had changed. You submitted the paperwork to change your name to Taylor. You told no one that you did it under the identity of a "Tom Andersen," though. At this point you were pretty sure that you were never actually a woman named Sara, but rather than think about that, you just plowed forward with life.

With CARA's assistance, you upgraded and changed your wardrobe, make it more professional and fashionable. You had also begun changing the decor in the house, very subtly. Sara's old pictures were slowly being replaced with photos of you and Jason, or Maria. You had also been using your neuroinformational transmitter to teach yourself some basic business administration, and were surprised to find that repeated use made the skills stick. At Jason's insistence, you had also used the device to learn a few other tricks. Just thinking about them made you blush.

Your life was a whirlwind of change. Tomorrow, you'd open up your new business to develop and market the neuroinformational transmitter for the masses. You still weren't sure you could handle being the owner of a company, but you knew that with the support of your friends, you'd get through it. You and Maria had been texting furiously over the past days, becoming even closer friends than you were before. She was so glad that she finally got to meet Jason, and you were also super enthusiastic and happy for her to be dating Chelsea.

Your primary task tomorrow would be to interview candidates for core positions in your new company. You curled up near Jason in your bed, wondering who you'd meet tomorrow.
14111112121111111211111121111111111.title: Another week later, Taylor has an entirely new ...

choices: "You look really familiar. Have we met before?"
141111121211111112111111211111111111.content:
You woke up very early the next day. You simply could not sleep: there was too much adrenaline. You had CARA dress you in a black business dress with nude stockings and matching stilettos. You wanted to rock your first day, and success started with dressing successfully. Your breakfast was light and simple. You were in the office by 7:00 AM. Your first--and primary--interview would arrive at 8. You busied yourself with administrative duties while you waited for his arrival.

And right at 8:00 AM, there was a knock on your door. The man that entered your office was tall and impressive. He was clean shaven and had a fresh haircut. His dark brown eyes were intense, yet soft. He was well put together. He shook your hand gently, saying, "Hello Ms. Andersen. My name is Chad."

"Please, just call me Taylor." Chad nodded. He seemed very familiar, but you couldn't quite place where you had met him before, if you had ever met him at all. The interview went smoothly. Chad knew his stuff, and his experience in the software industry would make him a valuable CTO. You showed him the device and explained to him how it could teach almost any skill in a matter of minutes. You even demonstrated it a bit, programming the headset to teach Chad how to do a back flip.

After two hours of chatting, you had reached an agreement on compensation, and you had your first new employee!

At the conclusion of the interview, Chad said...
141111121211111112111111211111111111.title: The next day, you interview another one of Tom&...

14111112121111111212.content:
You were about to answer that you would like to get ready and go for your walk, when you realized something. You rembered something!
When CARA asked me if I liked feminine clothing, I rembered the feeling of skirts and heels! Maybe if CARA asks me more questions, i might remember more about who I am!
"CARA!" you said exticedly "I'd like to answer some more questions for my profile!"
"Excelent Taylor. Let us continue with qustions on your wardrobe. Do you prefere heels or flats?" CARA asked.
"Heels" You said confidently, thinking back to your vauge memories. "Oh! And I prefere Skirts and Dresses over pants....I think."
"Noted" CARA said. "Do you prefere to dress Moderetly or more Revealing?"
"Umm..."
14111112121111111212.title: Answer more questions

choices: Actually, I think I like it Short.
141111121211111112121.content:
As you thought about the question, a dim memory seemed to dance just at the edge of your consciousness. Something about being undressed...and not liking it...
"Modestly" you say, thinking that you must not like men undressing you with their eyes.
"Excellent!" CARA said with robotic excitement. "I have enough information to dress you according to your preferences. Relax Taylor, as I begin to undress you."

Metal Arms reached out from the closet and began to undress you, removing the jeans, purple top, and even your shoes and underwear. The metal arms left you a little embaresed as exposed as they retreated back into the closet. After a short time they came back with a pair of white, lacy panites and a matching bra. Greatfully, you let the arms slide the undergarments on your bare body. Next came out a fairly long, and flowing soft pink skirt with brighter pink pokadots. The arms slid you in, the skirt reaching down a couple inches past your knees. After the skirt came a puffy white top with ties in the back and short sleaves that barely made it to your elbows. Finially came to open toed, soft pink heels which you exctied stepped into. You wanted to see if you remebered the fealing correctly.

You had. Doing a quick twirl and feeling the skirt bruch against your smooth legs felt very familiar. And quite nice! Giggling you did a few poses in the mirror. You were so pleased! You had been so scared, not remembering anything, that the feeling of something even slighly familar had you feeling giddy.

"I take it by your response, you are pleased with the outfit." CARA interupted.
"I love it!" You said to busy thinking about your releif to actually consider the outfit.
"Wonderful. I will mark this outfit as a Favorite in my memory. This will help me to orgainize similar outfits in the futue. Now, Talyor. I have a few question about your hair. Do you prefer to have it up, or down?"
141111121211111112121.title: Modestly

1411111212111111121211.content:
You felt a vague gnawing in your head, a feeling of disliking when your hair was touching your neck.

"Up... I think." you said.

You couldn't remember ever having it up, but down felt wrong.

"And the color is to your liking?" CARA asked.

"Yeah, I like the color." you said. You had no memories of the color being or feeling wrong.

"All right, Taylor." CARA said.

The arms sat you down in the chair by the vanity and got to work, pulling your hair into a bun. The arms moved a small mirror around as you marveled at your new hairstyle, which only barely grazed your neck.

"Do you like it?" CARA asked.

"I think I do, CARA." you replied.

"Wonderful. Saving this hairstyle as a preference as well." CARA said.

"Is there anything else?" you asked.

"Just a few more questions." CARA said. "What style of makeup would you like? Natural, evening, etc?"
1411111212111111121211.title: Up

14111112121111111212111.content:
You gasped as you suddenly felt a flash of memory, of attempting to dodge the various cosmetics that CARA was pushing into your face. You remembered feeling trapped and unable to move.

"Natural." you said. "And be gentle with it."

"As you wish, Taylor." CARA said.

Complying with your request, CARA's arms acted delicately as it removed your previous makeup and replaced it with a more natural look. Once they were done, CARA displayed a mirror for you to look into.

"Are you satisfied?" CARA asked.

You looked at yourself. You weren't sure if this was how things were supposed to be, but you felt... right. Everything felt normal.

"Yes." you replied.

"Saving Natural look as a preference." CARA stated.

"All right then." you said, as the arms lifted you from the chair. "Time to head out."
14111112121111111212111.title: Natural

141111121211111112121111.content:
You walked down the stairs in your modes heels, the flowing skirt brushing against your legs on every step. You felt normal again, although you still were not sure if this is what it was SUPPOSED to feel like. You did know that people with amnesia usually returned to normal slowly over time, so you assumed that this was the first step in your journey towards returning to who you were. Since it felt normal, you assumed the following:

You were a woman. You were usually modest, and only used cosmetics tastefully. You must be smart, as you created CARA. You still weren't sure if your name was Taylor, but it was a good name as any. Your walk was mostly uneventful, but the surrounding neighborhood did feel familiar to you. You had been here multiple times. You thus assumed you definitely lived here. You walked to the corner shop, and caught a glimpse of your reflection in the mirror. You looked beautiful and carefree. And you still felt normal. Taylor was your new normal.

You exited the store about ten minutes later, carrying a bag with some snacks and drinks for later. The evening was getting on, and you took a moment to simply savor the sunset. You felt at peace. You got the feeling that your life before the accident was perhaps a bit too fast-paced, and maybe this was the universe's way of sorting it out. You had taken the long way home, the scenic path around the nearby lake. There were not many people on the path, so you took your time to enjoy standing at the railing overlooking the calm water.

You were interrupted by an, "Excuse me, do we know each other?" You were snapped out of your zen state and turned to the newcomer. You saw...
141111121211111112121111.title: Heading out for a walk

choices: Yes, it's time for a date!
No, I'm still trying to figure things out.
1411111212111111121211112.content:
You saw a young woman with wavy shoulder-length brown hair standing there. "Sorry, miss? Do I know you? You seem familiar!" You shook your head, trying to get back into reality. "Uh, sorry, no, I don't think so. Although you do seem familiar to me. My name is Taylor. Or at least I think it is." The woman cocked her head at you. She was beautiful, even more beautiful than you. Your heart suddenly lept a bit. Were you attracted to her? You assumed that as a woman you were attracted to men, but perhaps that wasn't actually the case...

The woman said, "Oh, my name is Maria. Nice to meet you." She stuck out a manicured hand, and you awkwardly returned the handshake. "I am having some memory problems," you explained. "I was just in an accident." Maria held her hands up to her mouth. "Oh no, that's terrible!" she exclaimed. You explained further, saying that you had just hit your head, and likely your memories would return in a few days--it wasn't really anything to worry about.

The two of you continued to talk for the next 15 minutes, which turned into a half an hour, and before you knew it, the two of you had been sitting on a bench for an hour and half talking about all sorts of topics. The conversation was lively, perfectly flowing, and not slowing down. Maria had playfully put a hand on your leg, and your eyes were locked. Maria asked, "Hey, uh, do you maybe want to get a drink with me tomorrow? I know a great wine bar downtown..."
1411111212111111121211112.title: One of Sara's friends.

1411111212111111121212.content:
Looking back in the mirror, you examined your hair, then brought it up into a pony tail with you hand. The sudden absence of the feeling of hair tickling your shoulders felt...wrong. Some of Sara’s memories and feeling started to invade your mind a little
"Definitely down." You say nodding. Then a memory stuck you. It was of a girl, who wore her hair down, often braided with ribbons. She was a ....Cheerleader! While you assumed what this memory was of you from highschool, it was actually a memory of your highschool girlfriend, A bubbly blonde haired girl who, if you could only remember, had a very girly taste in music.
"CARA?" You asked. "Would it be possible to die my hair Blonde...I think it used to be blonde..."

"Of Course Taylor!" Suddenly, a swivling barber chair appeared out of a hole in the floor directly under you. With a slight jolt of surprise you fell into it as the Arms retuned, clasping a pink salon cape over your clothes. "Is there any thing else you'd like done with your hair? Bangs perhaps?"

An image of you ex-girlfriends hair flashed gain in your mind. "Yes! And could we try some curls as well."
"Certainly Taylor!" CARA said, pleased that you seemed to be remembering some things. As the Arms began to run your hair though a sink, CARA aksed, "Taylor, my research says that music can be very helpful in restoring lost memories. Perhaps we should try listen to the radio and finding music you like."

"Great idea CARA!"

As your hair was trimmed, styled, and died, you listened to a lot of different songs. While many of the songs you seemed to recognize where some of your old favorites, some were actually Sara's favorites. Most, however, were your past girlfriend's favorites. Perhaps it was because you were subconsciously thinking about her, or maybe it was just the catchy nature of most of her music, but most of the songs CARA marked as your favorites would have shown up on her girly pop music playlists.

After a few hours CARA swiviled your chair the mirror. "What do you think, Taylor?"

You felt a blast of unexplainable nostalgia as you looked into the mirror. You now had long bangs with a slight curl framing your face and a surprisingly long wavy deep blonde hair. Pink and White ribbons were tied, keeping your right side bangs out of your face and in a braid that trailed down your back with the rest of your hair.
"I love it." You stammer out. You’re not consciously sure why you love it so much, but deep inside your mind the hair style and music is bringing back all the feelings you used to have with your ex. All you consciously knew was that you were a fan of the new style.

"Wonderful Taylor! I had to use new hair implants and extensions to achieve the new lengths and style. While it may seem like real hair, it is simply a new polymer that mimics hair texture. It will not grow, unfortunately."

You nod, only half listening as you run your hand through your new bangs, transfixed by your reflection.

"However, the color pallet for your makeup no longer fits with your outfit or hair style. We will have to modify it. Would you prefer heavy or light makeup?"
1411111212111111121212.title: Down

14111112121111111212122.content:
"My current makeup is a bit too heavy, I think." CARA agreed with you, and replaced the loud colors with a lighter, more demure palate. It accentuated your natural features and blended in with your new outfit and style. You looked completely different than you did at the start when you had just woken up. When you woke up in that lab coat and jeans, you would daresay you even looked tomboyish! But now you were definitely 100% a girly girl, and you liked it. You didn't really stop to consider WHY you liked it, you just knew that you did.

With your new modest outfit, blond hair, and light makeup, it was finally time to go on the walk. CARA placed a pastel-colored purse on your shoulder, and you were soon out the door. The weather was nice. Sunny and just warm enough to be pleasant without being overbearing. You took in all the sights and smells, just content to be feeling somewhat familiar with yourself (or so you thought) again.

You meandered through the neighborhood without any specific destination in mind. You walked past house after house, until you finally stumbled upon a certain, very specific house. The house itself did not look much different than the ones around it. However, it triggered something deep inside you. Subconsciously, you knew this was Tom's house! Your house! But how that manifested in your conscious mind was another story. How did you proceed?

141111121211111112121221.content:
You walk up to the house, transfixed by how familiar it seemed. The front door seemed to call to you, awakening something deep down in your altered and locked away memories. With a light knock at the front door, you waited patiently for someone to answer. When no one did, you blinked in confusion. What were you doing? Knocking on some stranger’s house. You turned to walk away, but before you could you noticed the welcome mat.

Reaching under it without thought you pulled out the spare key you (as Tom) kept in case you were locked out of your house. Astounded by the discovery you go and unlock the door to this strange, familiar house and walk inside.

“Woah” You faintly whisper, as you take your first steps inside.

You are hit by a barrage of familiar smells and sights as you take in all the posters, video games, and old bits of take out scattered across the living room. While you can’t place any specific memories, you are 100% certain you’ve been in this house before- recently and often.

Your heels clicking across the wooden floor you look around and pick up a framed photo on a table. There in the photo is a familiar looking man and woman standing in front of some university building waving at the camera.

With a sudden headache you drop the photograph. Distantly you hear the glass shatter, but you are to focused on the realization that just hit you about the man in the photograph!
141111121211111112121221.title: Home Again?

While you are still certain that you regular visit this house, you have no idea who the man in the photo is. However different memories have surfaced from your amnesia ridden mind. You recognized that college! You even think you might have gone there, or are going there- that part is still hazy. You even know where it is!

You bolt out the door so fast you almost forget to lock back up- remembering when you are already a quarter of the way down the block. As you turn around to lock your…friend’s?...house, you start toy think through your actions with a little more sense. That college is a fair distance from your town, if your foggy memories can be trusted. At least a 4-hour drive. While a huge part of you wants to rush off to follow your first solid lead about who you are, the university will have to wait for another day.

Giggling too your self about how much of a thoughtless ditz you could apparently be, you strode back into the house to take stock of the situation. With crossed legs and perfect posture, you sat down in the arm chair in the middle of the room and thought about the day, what had worked so far, and any possible new ideas.


This of left you with some choices about how to go forward.

You could continue you walk around town and see if anything else would help piece together your forgotten past.

You could go home to CARA and see if she had figured out any new ways to jog either your or her memory.

Or you could stay here and investigate the house further, waiting for someone to show up.


Nodding yourself you stood up straight, clutching your purse in determination. You decided…
1411111212111111121212213.title: You have no idea who that Man is!

14111112121111111212122133.content:
Continuing to clutch your purse, you decided to stay and investigate the house. It was too familiar. You walked through the rooms on the first floor again, briefly stopping to pick the picture up off the floor. Every room seemed like you had been there before. Almost like you lived there. Perhaps the man was your boyfriend? You went upstairs to check the bedrooms. Surely if you lived there, you'd find your clothes and other possessions there. Examination of the bedrooms showed that only a man seemed to live in this house. At the entrance to the master bedroom, you had another headache. The more you thought about it, the more obvious it seemed like you lived here. But it still didn't make sense!

You opened the master bedroom's closet, expecting at least some of it to have blouses, skirts, and dresses in it. Or women's shoes. Or anything familiar. But alas! Nothing was familiar! It was only men's clothing! You pulled out one of the shirts from the closet and looked at it. It was from a metal band that you recognized but didn't like. Their music just wasn't your style... or was it? A strange idea entered your mind: what if you put the shirt on?

You undid your blouse and pulled it over your head, placing it on the bed, and replaced it with the band shirt. The shirt hung comically loose on you; it wasn't cut for your body. You stepped over to the mirror. The combination of the loose, casual shirt clashed strongly with your lower half, which actually looked put-together and fashionable. You were trying to remember something. It was almost like these casual men's clothes were familiar, almost like you used to wear them regularly. They felt heavy and scratchy, and they didn't fit properly. Not to mention they weren't made for a woman. How could you possibly have worn them in the past? Still, something itched in the back of your mind...

Something terrible must of happened. Something like a break up....

With a desperation you never felt before you yanked the familiar- yet unwanted T-shirt off and carefully draped your white top back onto your body. A perfect fit! Nodding to yourself at this equally familiar, but much warmer feeling, coursing though your body you became more certain of your conclusion. Stopping only to double check the name of the Man who lived here- Tom- you rushed out and locked the door on your former life behind you.

Unkowingly walking out of your own house, with the certain knowledge that you used to date yourself, you felt a certain level of unease. While this was mostly due to the revulsion that CARA had programed into you, you interptrited it as uneaseness to breaking into your 'Exs' House. Needing to cheer yourself up, your mind races to come up with a pleasent distraction. The only question is what part of your mind comes up with an idea first? CARA's feminine programing, Tom's orginal subconsious, or Taylor's limited concious memories?

Begining to walk down the street you decide to...

1411111212111111121212213322.content:
That was something that always made you happy. You weren't sure why, but among all your girly interests, comic books were one of the only "boy" things you enjoyed. You confidently strutted off in the direction of the comic book store. Another piece of the puzzle solved! If you remembered where the store was, then you obviously lived in this area, or at least spent a lot of time in the area. The walk was quite a ways from your current location, but it was a nice day out. The only thing you worried about was your choice of footwear. While your shoes were cute, you weren't sure if they would make it all the way to the comic book store. The height of the heeled sandals were not that high, but they were still high enough to cause you to alter your walking posture. You had to sway your hips and strut forward.

Twenty minutes later, you made it to the comic book store. Your feet were a bit sore, but it was nothing that you couldn't handle! You did think you'd take a taxi back, though.

Ding! You entered the store and instantly remembered it. It was a modern, clean establishment. Their main merchandise was comics, but they also sold a few nerdy things on the side. You casually started to browse, slowly gravitating towards the superhero comics, until you finally honed in on the Deecarvel Comics section. One of the most popular publishers, Deecarvel had a huge array of superheroes and a comic that appealed to almost everyone. You immediately grabbed what you knew was your favorite: Night Owl. The comic chronicled the ongoing adventures of a detective that donned a cape and mask to bring justice to the streets in a corrupt and dangerous city.

"Hi there, do you need any help?" You let out a sudden squeak, jolted back to reality! One of the store's employees was standing there in front of you. His name tag said Jason. "Sorry, you were standing there staring at this shelf for a while. You looked a little bit lost," he laughed. You glared at him, and scolded him in your sweet, feminine voice: "I'm not -lost-! I'm here to get the new issue of Night Owl!" There was no way that you could ever sound menacing. Jason said, "Is your boyfriend into Night Owl? We have some other comics he might like too!"

That set you off. "What, just because I'm a girl, you think I can't read comics?!" Your sweet voice was tinged with a hint of frustration. You tore into Jason, explaining that you had read Night Owl for years! And that you had very particular preferences, and that you were -NOT- shopping for your boyfriend. In fact, you didn't have one! (Or did you?)

Jason took your berating and replied, "I, uh, no. I don't mean that. It's just that we don't get people ... dressed this well in here, usually." That compliment made you stop in the middle of your rant and blush. "Say, do you want to hang out later? Consider it an apology from me." There was something very familiar about Jason. It was like you had known him before. Did you used to go to the same school together or something? He made you feel connected to your missing memories. He felt like an old friend.

"I get off in three hours."
1411111212111111121212213322.title: Go Pick Up Some Comic Books! (Tom)

choices: To keep you sane, the feminine programming has deleted some of Tom's subconsciou
You suddenly become extremely interested in a girly hobby.
14111112121111111212122133221.content:
Three hours later, you were hanging out with Jason at a cafe near the comic shop in a small mall. He had brought out one box of his own comic book collection, which he apparently kept at the store. The two of you were getting along extremely well. Jason was showing you his old comic collection, and you were having an in-depth conversation about it.

"You know, Taylor, you remind me of an old friend I used to have. His name was Tom. He was also into comics, especially Night Owl." You blinked at that. You were hanging out with a friend of your ex? Inwardly, you shrugged to yourself. Jason seemed nice, and it wouldn't be fair to categorize him like Tom. But Jason did seem really familiar, in some way. Why was that? Your ruminations were pushed down when Jason waved his hand in front of your face. "Hello, Earth to Taylor? Are you there?"

You blinked. "I... yes! I am here!" you stated dramatically. This made Jason laugh again. You laughed with him. You felt very comfortable around him, like you could easily be friends. You didn't feel any romantic attraction to him. Just like you could easily fit in with him and just chill. You definitely needed some chilling, with your amnesia. The two of you hung out at the cafeteria for another hour. By this point, Jason had noticed some strange similarities. He said, "You know, my friend Tom was into a lot of the same stuff as you. Maybe not the 'cute dresses' and stuff, but otherwise a lot of the same. Have you met him before?" Jason was inspecting you acutely, as deep down he suspected something very odd. Could you be his old friend Tom? There were absolutely zero traces of masculinity in your appearance, and he let the idea go.

When Jason asked you about Tom, you felt confused and uneasy again. You told Jason, "I ... used to date Tom. We had a lot of the same interests, I guess. But it didn't work out." Jason shrugged. "Strange, Tom never told me about you. He was kind of secretive about stuff like this, I guess. Maybe he thought no one would believe he was dating someone like you." Your face turned a deep in reaction to the flirtatious compliment. The conversation took a momentary pause. You barely managed to squeak out a, "Thank you." Jason just smiled.

Eventually, your hanging out had to come to an end. Jason went home, and so did you. Or at least what you thought might be your home. You announced, "I'm home, CARA!" The house greeted you warmly: "Welcome home, Taylor. I have prepared a small meal and a relaxing evening for you." You were happy there was at least something consistent and easy in your life now. You recounted the day to CARA, and she used all of it to update her profile of you.

You couldn't stop thinking about what Jason said about Tom and how similar you were. Your mind went over the details repeatedly, and then you started to get a headache again. Why did you and Tom like so many of the same things? Why did you get along so well with Jason? You fell into a spiral of self-questioning, and finally blacked out. When you came to, your subconscious had concocted a solution to your problem.
14111112121111111212122133221.title: Yes, let's hang out. (3 hours later)

"Maybe another time" you say coldly. While Jason certainly felt familiar, your interactions with him have proven rather unfortunate so far. While Jason looked a tad crest fallen, you give him a small smile as you turn and make your way to the register. You'd be stopping by again any way- their was chance enough for the boy to redeem himself in the future. At the counter Jason offered to ring up your comics, seeing an opportunity you also add a large Night Owl statue from the high self. You make no attempt to hide your giggling as he grumbles to himself about getting the foot ladder.

Staring up at the rather familiar boy as he gently lowered a rather large statue, a sudden thought crossed your mind. This boy was rather cute! This thought caused a confusing reaction in your head. Some part of you (the deeply hidden Tom part) was upset, and even frightened that you found this friendly boy ('your' best friend) cute. Confused at this, you continued to stare straight ahead, pondering these confusing feelings. You were a girl, you were fairly certain you had an ex-boyfriend, what was the harm in finding this boy cute?


"See anything else you like?"


Jumping back to reality, you give a sharp 'eep!' of surprize and face a now smirking Jason. Surprize quickly turned to annoyance as snatched the bagged comics out of his outstreached hand, glaring up at the far to pleased man.

"You can carry that staue outsode for me" You commanded with the most confidence you had had since waking up. "Im going to call a cab."

****

As you and Jason waited for your cab to pull up and you pondered you fellings further, something caught your eye. Or rather Someone. A young woman about your own age...How old were you again? Damn amneisa...dressed in a rather revealing pink top and white short shorts made her way across the street. Something about her...excited you. A sudden quite whisper next to you sanpped your atttention from the cute girl and back to Jason, who now seemed to be giving you quite the look.


"Guess I'm not your type then, huh?"

At first confused, it took you a few moments before piecing togethor everything that just happened. With a groan you realized their might be a reason you didn't want to be with a man at that moment. What if you left Tom for a girl! What if that's why boyish things tended to provoke such a negative reaction. You stammered out a quick "Finding myself" face completly red as you quickly looked away from him. As the cab pulled up and Jason put the statue in the seat for you, you took another look at his backside. The feeling in your chest told you that you deffintly had somethings to figure out.

With a short goodbye to this boy who had given you a lot to think about, you took the cab back home to CARA. Once there you decided....
14111112121111111212122133222.title: Perhaps another time.

141111121211111112121221332222.content:
It was time to look at some porn.

By the time you had arrived home, you were hot and bothered. You were simultaneously turned on and also confused and afraid. You felt a strange attraction to Jason, but were also repulsed on some level. Similarly, you felt an attraction to that girl you saw, but that made you confused. If you were dating a man, wouldn't that mean you were heterosexual? But then why did you feel confused about finding Jason cute?

To answer that question, you left it up to "science." You dropped the stuff you had purchased at the comic store off at the table, and raced upstairs. You entered your bedroom and stripped off your clothing, keeping only your panties and bra on. You turned on your phone started searching. You stared with what you thought would be the most obvious choice: heterosexual situations, completely vanilla. But your search quickly expanded into more "exotic" fare. All the while, you were exploring your own body. You didn't have much sensation in your breasts, but down there, you could certainly feel things.

Your thoughts involved both men and women, and the fantasies that brought you to the edge gave them both equal time. Somewhere deep inside you, the thoughts of Tom were screaming out in rage about the fantasies you were having, but your mind was too enslaved to lust to care. When you finally reached the climax, you were imagining yourself as the woman, on the bottom. With each convulsion, your mind reinforced one idea: you were a woman. With each fantasized thrust, the screaming voice of Tom that told you this wasn't right got softer and softer. With the final convulsion, it disappeared completely.

You were a woman.

You were also bisexual. It was the only logical conclusion. You decided that you were definitely a bit on the submissive side, and wouldn't "wear the pants" in a relationship, and that was fine. It felt right. Not that you didn't want an equal relationship, but you felt like you wanted someone to "take charge."

And then, you slept. You slept peacefully, having vivid dreams that were almost as interesting as your fantasies earlier. You awoke to the sunrise peeking through the curtains in your bedroom. It was a brand new day, and on some level, you felt like a brand new person. More complete, more whole. The amnesia was starting to go away, you thought! Enough of your life was getting pieced together that you could form a coherent narrative (even if that narrative was completely wrong).

It was going to be hot today. Departing slightly from what you picked yesterday, you asked CARA to dress you in casually in shorts and a T-shirt. What you got was anything but casual, however. CARA dressed you in tight beige shorts with a slightly-loose light pink blouse tucked into it. The sleeves of the blouse were rolled up just above your elbows, and you had one extra button unbuttoned, showing off a bit of cleavage. The outfit was completed with flat beige sandals.

At first you were unsure of the outfit, but after you saw and felt your smooth legs in the shorts, you were happy with it. "CARA, please mark this outfit as another favorite!" you said. "Affirmative, Taylor," was the AI's simple response.

After eating breakfast, you decided to continue to connect more pieces of your life together. But how to do it?

The false narrative you had constructed in your mind was a feedback loop, and soon your original memories, Sara's implanted memories, and other experiences had all warped together into a single thread that was coherent enough to explain your entire life. CARA had been noting your preferences down, and helping you construct a profile of your own, new self. By the end of the week, your focus had turned to pragmatic concerns. You seemed to be missing an ID. Coming up with proof of identity was proving difficult. From digging through records in the house, you learned that it wasn't even yours! Sarah, Tom's brother, lived here.

Your false narrative told you that you were friend with Sarah and that she was letting you crash here while you worked on your CARA project. You subconsciously ignored most of the holes in this story. You did need to get a new ID, though. You asked CARA, "Can you add me to the address of this house so that bills start getting addressed to me?" and CARA was happy to oblige.
